intro: Lepechiniella alatavica, commonly known as the Alatavica lepechiniella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
